Articles.Content:
You know, I haven't found what I was looking for.

A MASSIVE, LOOOONNNGGGG Zeppelin balloon. Like the Hindenburg. (I know this can probably be done with some extra ridgid ballons, but there is no cone cap or tail cap to make it look like a zeppline, and its also too flat.

Nice work getting it all updated though.

and great work with that drone.

You know, I haven't found what I was looking for.

A MASSIVE, LOOOONNNGGGG Zeppelin balloon. Like the Hindenburg. (I know this can probably be done with some extra ridgid ballons, but there is no cone cap or tail cap to make it look like a zeppline, and its also too flat.

Nice work getting it all updated though.

and great work with that drone.

So if i understand you, you would like a BIG version of the drone? Like at a 5m or 7.5m scale?

So if i understand you, you would like a BIG version of the drone? Like at a 5m or 7.5m scale?

I think that would fit his request quite well, if it's surface-attachable. Then we can turn KSP into an alternate alternate universe.

I think that would fit his request quite well, if it's surface-attachable. Then we can turn KSP into an alternate alternate universe.

Rodger that~! 7.5mX20m airship in the 'OMG is that an airship or an anti-planet torpedo' class coming up! *engines not included*

Rodger that~! 7.5mX20m airship in the 'OMG is that an airship or an anti-planet torpedo' class coming up! *engines not included*

Dunno if like insanity or love the insanity... =D

Dunno if like insanity or love the insanity... =D

Will yield a base volume of 4860m3. About 75% of the lift of a Sirrus. However I plan to go on and double that math so it will be about 1.5x the lifting volume. Will give QUITE the kick!

EDIT: To clear up the math I am taking a sphere and sticking half on each end of the main cylinder to add volume and make it look better.

Volume for this is = (PI()*(7.5^2)*20)+((4/3)+PI()*(7.5^3))

Edited December 3, 2013 by JewelShisen
added math and SCIENCE!!!

Will yield a base volume of 4860m3. About 75% of the lift of a Sirrus. However I plan to go on and double that math so it will be about 1.5x the lifting volume. Will give QUITE the kick!

EDIT: To clear up the math I am taking a sphere and sticking half on each end of the main cylinder to add volume and make it look better.

Volume for this is = (PI()*(7.5^2)*20)+((4/3)+PI()*(7.5^3))

You're trying to melt my computer by giving us these toys! BTW, that little probe airship I made a while back is epic to drop on Jool. Had to include a generator for it, but it was awesome.

You're trying to melt my computer by giving us these toys! BTW, that little probe airship I made a while back is epic to drop on Jool. Had to include a generator for it, but it was awesome.

Just filling a niche. Of course that niche could be called 'Is this an airship envelope or a spent battery from the Death Star?'

Got it up and running in game! Just have to fix the attachment nodes.

http://imgur.com/u4oMsU5

Got it up and running in game! Just have to fix the attachment nodes.

http://imgur.com/u4oMsU5

Nice textures!

Behold! The DEATH STAR class airship envelope! At 5m wide and 25m long this is the LARGEST airship part to date and has a record breaking 9819.6 lifting volume, a full 1.5 TIMES the Cirrus! This part has NO nodes so you must radial attach it (but really would you WANT that monster in a stack?).

Dropbox (Requires HL Airship plugin of course): https://www.dropbox.com/s/6kqe9d9yivusrox/HL%20DSClass.zip
Hummm.....my steel zeppelin force now grows..... most excellent.

Hummm.....my steel zeppelin force now grows..... most excellent.

Hehe~ And I just MAY make a bigger one
Could we maybe get matching "front" and "rear" caps for the old lifting bodies as well? :3

Could we maybe get matching "front" and "rear" caps for the old lifting bodies as well? :3

I will see what I can do though no promise. I don't have the original models so it may take some time.
Is that modular? It looks almost like you could extend it indefinately.

Is that modular? It looks almost like you could extend it indefinately.

Is what Modular?

Is what Modular?

The death star - he asks whether it is made up of small segments, I believe. But since it isn't stack attachable, it can't be extended. By the way, you should make a stack attachable version without the endcaps.

The death star - he asks whether it is made up of small segments, I believe. But since it isn't stack attachable, it can't be extended. By the way, you should make a stack attachable version without the endcaps.

It is not. It is all one piece to increase structural strength.

Plans do exist to make a larger version (10m x 40m) of it as well as a stack version that will be half the length (10m) of the main cylinder and have about 75% of the lift of the Cirrus.
Still want to see the launchpads back =(

Still want to see the launchpads back =(

Those have my top priority right now

Those have my top priority right now

Awesome!
now THAT is what I'm talking about!

Ok I have my Ike part up and running. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/hl-ike-addon-4/

just throw it in your hooligan labs folder and it's good to go.

To elaborate on the Poll options:

The new feature would be either kOS support or I'll try and add a new auto balance feature.

The other option is one that I would would need your input for. So if you pick it then please either post your desire or PM it to me.
